alert.note: Alert for Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 4:10PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Okaloosa and east central Santa Rosa Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 310 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Roeville, or 13 miles east of Milton, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Okaloosa and east central Santa Rosa Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
